item.title: Prime+Probe 1, JavaScript 0: Overcoming Browser-based Side-Channel Defenses
item.description: Abstract The “eternal war in cache” has reached browsers, with multiple cache-based side-channel attacks and countermeasures being suggested. A common approach for countermeasures is to disable or restrict javaScript features deemed essential for carrying out attacks. A recent proposal following this approach is Chrome Zero, a browser add-on that intercepts and changes the semantics of some JavaScript features, while claiming minimal impact on user experience.

item.title: 5 tools I use to protect my privacy online
item.description: It shouldn’t have to be this way, but the burden of protecting your privacy as you browse the web is your own. I do what I can in my research and consulting to advocate for systemic change in design and policy to reduce the burden on the individual user; but that kind of change is slow to fruit. Meanwhile, there are tools that you, the individual, can use to partially protect yourself against the forces of surveillance capitalism and other institutional privacy threats. I will share five that I use myself.
item.author: (Sauvik Das, Ph.D.)

item.title: The Mars Helicopter is Online and Getting Ready to Fly - Universe Today
item.description: Earth is the only planet in the solar system with aircraft capable of sustained flight. Suppose the ground-breaking Ingenuity helicopter, currently stowed aboard the similarly spectacular Mars Perseverance rover, accomplishes its planned mission.
